At 09:56 PM 1/25/01 , Peter Bismuti wrote:
>/home/peterb/Java/PSSGLib_1_0_2/build.xml:219: Could not create task of
>type: junit because I can't find it in the list of task class definitions.
>Common solutions are: 1 execute bin/bootstrap. 2 use taskdef to declare your
>task. 3 add the task to defaults.properties.

This means that it's not in the task list, which is odd, since it seems to
be part of there in the default installation.  I just now double-checked
this by blowing away my Ant installation and re-installing from my copy of
the Ant 1.2 binary distribution.  JUnit tasks worked just fine once I
dropped the 1.2 version of "optional.jar" into the "lib" directory.

If you look at the file "org/apache/tools/ant/taskdefs/defaults.properties"
in "ant.jar", you should already have a line:

junit=org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTask

If that doesn't work for you, you can always just include the following
<taskdef> at the top of your build.xml file:

<taskdef name="junit"
classname="org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTask"/>



John Brewer
Jera Design
subject: Re: [junit] how to set up ant to run the junit task?
